message.content: A pizza is a savory Italian dish made of a round flatbread crust topped with tomato sauce, cheese, and various other ingredients such as meat, vegetables, and herbs. The crust of a pizza is typically crispy on the outside and chewy on the inside, with a golden-brown color. The sauce can be thick or thin, and may have a rich tomato flavor or other seasoning. The cheese on a pizza is typically melted and stretches when pulled apart. Pizzas are commonly served in restaurants, pizzerias, and homes, and are a popular food for parties and gatherings. They can be cooked in a traditional brick oven, wood-fired oven, or modern electric oven. The appearance of a pizza can vary greatly depending on the toppings chosen, but it is typically a recognizable, circular shape.
